name: Xubinzheng.github.io
body: ### Welcome to Xubin's GitHub Pages. ##Objective •To obtain an internship position working as Software Engineer starting in summer 2015, using my specializing in Java developing and knowledge in data structures and algorithm ##Relevant Experience ####Photo_brush, Fall 2013 • Provide a button in the pixel inspector tool that copies the current pixel information to the paint brush tool as the color chosen for painting. • Add a slider to the paint brush user interface to control the size of the brush. • Modify the paint brush tool to allow the "opacity" of the paint to be controlled. Let opacity be determined as a percentage between 0 and 100 which controls the blending of the paint brush color and the existing color of the pixels being painted. • Add a new "blur" tool that acts like a paint brush but instead of painting a color it blurs an area of the picture. Include controls for determining the blur area size. (https://github.com/xubinzheng/photo_brush) ####ImageAdjuster_and_Puzzle, Fall 2013 • Add a slider to the paint brush user interface to control the brush factor from 1 to 5. • Add a slider to the paint brush user interface to control the size of the Saturation of image from -100 to 100. • Add a slider to the paint brush user interface to control the size of the bBrightness of image from -100 to 100. • The puzzle: click the block and have fun (https://github.com/xubinzheng/ImageAdjuster_and_Puzzle) ####IBM IoT Design Challenge, Fall 2014 • Captain and lead developer of team BlueCrew. Designed and developed the application for IOS platform on XCode development environment. The front-end part involving IBMBluemix(PaaS), CoreBluetooth and Cocoa Touch frameworks. The main feature, which automatically searches the nearby Bluetooth(BLE) device, involving MVC, Observer and Delegate design pattern. • Implemented a function, which automatically uploads the BKON device’s data to IBM cloud service, using MySQL database service on cloud to track the device. The project website and demo (http://xubinzheng.github.io/BlueCrew) ####Minecraft Mod “LambdaCraft” Development, Winter 2014 • Designed and developed the Mod “LambdaCraft” for game Minecraft which was written in Java, using Forge API and CraftBukkit plugin on Eclipse IDE. Expanded the crafting list, weapons and game mode. • Analyzed and fixed serious bugs, so far the estimated download quantity is about 5K. (http://http://lambdacraft.cn/) (http://www.mcbbs.net/forum.php?mod=viewthread&tid=176855&highlight=%E5%8D%8A%E6%9D%A1%E5%91%BD) ####IOS SpriteKit game “FlappyRect”, Fall 2014 • Designed and developed the game “FlappyRect” refers FlappyBird on IOS platform for fun. • Using SpriteKit and UIKit frameworks. (https://github.com/xubinzheng/FlappyRect) ####Web design and development, Summer 2014 • Implemented the page controllers for family business using JavaScript and JQuery framework in collaboration with the UI design team and the server-side team. (http://www.jiacaomu.com) ##Revelant skills • Object-oriented design and coding skills: JAVA (3 years), C (2 years), Objective-C (1 year) • Web design and others: JavaScript, HTML, MATLAB, SAS, GAMS • Database: MySql • Operating System: Windows, OS X, UNIX ##Revelant Class COMP 410 Data Strature COMP 411 Computer Organization COMP 431 Internet Service COMP 455 Models of Languages and Computation STOR 445 Stochastic Models in Operations Research STOR 455 Statistical Methods STOR 472 Short Term Actuarial Models ####This page will show some of my projects. Involving JAVA, SWIFT and Object-C language. #IBM IOT design project ###This is a High-Value Asset Tracking software using Bluetooth Low Energy Beacon ####Solving: Tracking assets in a hospital environment where the location history of all patients and important assets are monitored and stored in order to lower costs and improve quality of patient care ####Please check more information @ xubinzheng.github.io/BlueCrew • Captain and lead developer of team BlueCrew. Designed and developed the application on IOS platform. The front-end part used IBMBluemix(PaaS), BKON-SDK and Cocoa Touch frameworks. • Developed a function using MVC and Observer and delegate design pattern which checks the location of a Bluetooth Low Energy(BLE) iBeacon, in our case a BKON A1 device, with a 30m circle. • Implemented a feature, which automatically upload the BKON device’s parameters to IBM cloud service, using MySQL database service on cloud serve to track the device that conform to the user’s requirements. #IBM BlueMix mobile data IOS SDK "pod install" error solution From(https://www.ng.bluemix.net/docs/#starters/mobile/ios/ios.html). When running the "pod install" command, the following error is returned: [!] Due to the previous naïve CocoaPods resolver, you were using a pre-release version of IBMBluemix, without explicitly asking for a pre-release version, which now leads to a conflict. Please decide to either use that pre-release version by adding the version requirement to your Podfile (e.g. pod 'IBMBluemix', '= 1.0.0.20140707-1250') or revert to a stable version by running pod update IBMBluemix. However, running pod update IBMBluemix results in: [!] Due to the previous naïve CocoaPods resolver, you were using a pre-release version of IBMFileSync, without explicitly asking for a pre-release version, which now leads to a conflict. Please decide to either use that pre-release version by adding the version requirement to your Podfile (e.g. pod 'IBMFileSync', '= 1.0.0.20140707-1250') or revert to a stable version by running pod update IBMFileSync. and trying pod update IBMFileSync results in it looping back to the error about updating IBMBluemix pod. It seems the latest update to Cocoapods is causing this issue. I was forced to revert to an earlier version to allow the dependencies to install correctly. If you have the latest version installed you will have to call: ``` [sudo] gem uninstall cocoapods ``` I was forced to uninstall the other gems as well: ``` [sudo] gem uninstall cocoapods-core [sudo] gem uninstall cocoapods-downloader [sudo] gem uninstall cocoapods-plugins [sudo] gem uninstall cocoapods-trunk [sudo] gem uninstall cocoapods-try ``` Then you can install any version below 0.35.0. I used 0.33.1 but 0.34 is supported as well: ``` [sudo] gem install cocoapods -v 0.33.1 ``` After done the previous steps, the Bluemix mobile data service SDK should be work. ``` https://www.ng.bluemix.net/docs/#starters/mobile/ios/ios.html ``` #IOS SpriteKit game “FlappyRect” • Designed and developed the game “FlappyRect” refers FlappyBird on IOS platform for fun. • Using SpriteKit and UIKit frameworks. # ImageAdjuster and Puzzle application There are three tools. Run PixelInspector.java : type your link in readFromURL, there already one there for testing. Click anywhere, then print out the RGB of that pixel Run ImageAdjuster.java : same as inspector, tap your link, then you can make chose of what to change on image, including blur, saturation and brightness change. But it’s a little bit slow or sometime need like 10s to finish The most interesting part, Run FramePuzzle : type your link, the photo in there are my CS pro kmp(really good man), then click a block which is next to empty block or the block on the same line of the empty block # Photo Brush tool open ImageEditor.java, you can enter your photo link in readFromURL(“”). There are three tools. Pixel Inspector: choose and click anywhere on photo, print the RGB of that pixel, then you can use set paintBrush Color tool Print Brush: make your chose, then click or pull anywhere on photo Blur Brush:same as print brush #KickNinja download the file and touch the screen, it's a small ios game. Please leave your commit. Created by Object-C # KickElizabeth There a problem I hope you can help me to solve it. I want to add a timer in GameScene.swift. If anyone touches the screen, then gameStarted = true, at the same time NSTimer works. If maskCode == MASK_EDGE|MAK_BALL, game is over, at the same time timer stoped. Then in the GameOverScene.swift, it will push out the time. Really thank you for your time ### Support or Contact Having trouble with Pages? Check out the documentation at http://help.github.com/pages or contact support@github.com and we’ll help you sort it out.
